In-App Purchases\n(Mandatory)

When a user taps an app icon to launch the app, initialize the app in the background so that statistics about app use can be collected and in-app bulletins can be displayed. Please note that this function is mandatory if the app is released in China.

After an app is launched or when a user proactively checks whether there is a later version, call the update API of the HMS Core SDK to check whether there is a later version available on AppGallery. If so, display a pop-up asking the user whether to update the app. Common apps do not support forcible update. Users can choose not to update apps immediately. Please note that this function is mandatory if the app is released in China.

Account Kit provides you with simple, secure, and quick sign-in and authorization functions. Instead of entering accounts and passwords and waiting for authentication, users can just tap the Sign in with HUAWEI ID button to quickly and securely sign in to your app with their HUAWEI IDs. Please note that this function is mandatory if the app is released in China.

IAP provides convenient in-app payment experience, which helps you boost monetization. Users can purchase a variety of virtual products, including one-time virtual products and subscriptions, directly within your app.
Game Service\n(Optional)
Game Update\n(Optional)

HUAWEI Game Service provides HUAWEI ID sign-in, game addiction prevention,floating window,achievements, events, leaderboards, saved games, player statistics and access to basic game information features for your app. Games to be released in the Chinese mainland must support the floating window and game addiction prevention functions.

After an app is launched or when a user proactively checks whether there is a later version, call the related API of the HMS Core SDK to check whether there is a later version available on AppGallery. Please note that games released in the Chinese mainland must call this API.

When a user taps an app icon to launch the app, initialize the app in the background so that statistics about app use can be collected and in-app bulletins can be displayed. Please note that if your app has a splash screen ad, initialize the app after the splash screen ad ends.

•This scenario is mandatory in the Chinese mainland and optional in other countries and regions.
•If your app provides a privacy agreement for users, it should call the init API after the user has accepted the privacy agreement.
•It is recommended that the app be initialized upon app launch, rather than during user operations such as sign-in and payment.

After an app is launched or when a user proactively checks whether there is a later version, call the update API of the HMS Core SDK to check whether there is a later version available on AppGallery. If so, display a pop-up asking the user whether to update the app. Common apps do not support forcible update. Users can choose not to update apps immediately. Please note that AppGalleryKit Game support non-immediate update and forcible update. For mobile game apps, you can enable force update. After this function is enabled, players must update the app to enter the game.

Joint operations services allow you to jointly operate your apps with Huawei and share revenue generated in the process. You will have access to diverse services of HUAWEI which are HUAWEI AppGallery connection, data reports, activity operations, and user operations to obtain more premium HUAWEI AppGallery resources to promote your apps.\n\n

To enable joint operations, you need to sign the HUAWEI AppGallery Connect Distribution Service Agreement For Paid Apps with Huawei. AppGalleryKit App is used for the non-game apps for which you have enabled joint operations, AppGalleryKit Game is used for the game apps for which you have enabled joint operations.\n\n
